intro: Phlomoides binaludensis, commonly known as the Binalud phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, narrow leaves, and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
